title: [BEAM-4767][BEAM-12337] Make default UW image for java beam_java#_sdk
body:
This PR: * switches "java" with "beam_java8/java11_sdk" for UW pipelines * separates beam-master-YYYYMMDD tags for FnAPI (Apache) and legacy (Dataflow-only) images, including some key/property name changes that touch many files * Determines container image tag based on if SDK is dev version or not. This is similar to Python SDK ([apiclient.py](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/python/apache_beam/runners/dataflow/internal/apiclient.py#L1141-L1147)) There is no existing "java" image for 2.XX.0 and beam-master-YYYYMMDD, so this won't break anything for users. Any tests that break should be fixed, since they are not correctly overriding the URL if they break. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-12333] Changing TimerKey to include TimerFamilyId
body:
`SamzaTimerInternalsFactory` stores timer state, event time and processing time timers alike, in the form of a `MapState, Long>`. `TimerKey`, however, doesn't include the `TimerFamilyId` and therefore the timer family information is not persisted. On the other hand, event time timers uses an additional time sorted set to persist the TimerData(which contains TimerFamilyId). We need to include timer family id in the TimerKey to ensure that it is persisted for Processing time timers. This PR aims to add `TimerFamilyId` to `TimerKey`. Additionally, I am switching to the use of `AutoValue` to reduce boilerplate code. ------------------------ `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-9547] Add support for drop_duplicates and duplicated
body:
This PR adds support for [`drop_duplicates`](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.drop_duplicates.html) and [`duplicated`](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.duplicated.html), by building on top of `groupby.apply()`. Also in this PR: - A bugfix to make groupby.apply() preserve the original column order. - A new test suite in frames_test.py called `BeamSpecificTest`, intended for testing functionality that only exists in Beam, like `keep='any'`. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-12246] Fix ib.collect(dataframe) indexing
body:
Indexing wasn't being properly propagated. This also preserves any hierarchical indexing from the dataframes. There is one problem with passing dataframes, however, which is that the indexing isn't kept and is reset per bundle. This solves this by resetting the index once the DataFrame is collected but only if it is an unnamed index. This behavior can be overridden with the `reset_unnamed_indexes=False` flag. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-9615] Make UUIDs deterministic on Go types.
body:
Schema UUIDs being random for every instance doesn't work for Go, which relies significantly on a deterministic identifier registry between worker and main program binary. Make the UUIDs deterministic based on the type name. The schema spec, such as it is only requires that two types with the same UUID are identical, which this method can support. This is largely an issue when trying to avoid deviations to the reflect libraries to do type conversions, which can tolerate converting a synthetic type to an equivalent specific type. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-12405] Reduce tail latency in Storage API writes
body:
Several improvements
   - Reduce cache timeout to a value smaller than the server-side timeout. This prevents us from hitting errors when we try to use a StreamWriter that has timed out on the server.
   - Reduce maximum retry interval to 10 seconds.
   -  Bound the bundle size to the StorageApiWriteXXXRecords classes by using GroupIntoBatches. Previously we would sometimes get very large bundles, and due to the design of the sink we cannot flush the writes until the entire bundle has been written. Bounding the bundle size allows us to flush these items more quickly.

title: [BEAM-10670] Use non-SDF based translation for Read by default on Spark Runner
body:
We have had many reports of performance degradation since the switch to the SDF by default read translation, and our own tests found between 20-25% performance degradation that we cannot justify. This PR is basically 'a revert' of #13021

It introduces the new `use_sdf_read` so we can still have a path to test the performance of the SDF path so we can be able to judge when to make it the default again.

R: @kennknowles 
CC: @boyuanzz @lukecwik @ibzib (for awareness)

title: Minor: Disable filesystem watching in Jenkins
body:
Noticed that some jenkins builds have logs like: ``` Unable to watch the file system for changes. The inotify watches limit is too low. ``` This seems to be happening because we have gradle [file system watching](https://blog.gradle.org/introducing-file-system-watching) on by default: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/ab80654623a67f0ff803195f73a8b1d41bd073e0/gradle.properties#L22 I think it's reasonable to turn this on by default, but there isn't value in using it in CI, so let's disable it there. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-12225] Replace AWS API used to list shards from DescribeStream to ListShards
body:
Beam currently uses AWS DescribeStream API to list Kinesis shards. There are few problems with it: - it is deprecated as per AWS [documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/streams/latest/dev/kinesis-using-sdk-java-list-shards.html) - it is slow, as it requires additional validation of listed shards (it returns all of them, including closed ones, so GetShardIterator calls are required) - it has low transaction limit per second (per account) - AWS changed the behaviour of GetShardIterator (it returns iterator for closed shards) and because of that Beam might read too old data, leading to increase in costs and delay Use of ListShards API eliminates problems mentioned above. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-12290] Fix reversed logic in assertThatSubscriptionEventuallyCreated timeout
body:
The timeout argument for `TestPubsub.assertThatSubscriptionEventuallyCreated` has reveresed logic, so it will never actually timeout. This is what's causing SQL PostCommit to hang indefinitely and abort after 4 hours (BEAM-12258). There's call to this method in testSQLLimit: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/2d253f915003279878b77827301428649881bec7/sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/meta/provider/pubsub/PubsubTableProviderIT.java#L442-L443 It should be timing out and failing the test but instead hangs indefinitely. Note I have not yet root caused the issue in testSQLLimit, so this will not completely fix SQL PostCommit. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-12272] Python - Backport Firestore connector's ramp-up throttling to Datastore connector
body:
A new connector for Cloud Firestore is being added to Beam and currently out for review (see #14261). Some of the features and adjustments are useful for Cloud Datastore as well, so they're being backported to this connector. ### Ramp-up throttling This follows the same implementation as the Firetore connector, though implemented as a subtransform in the Write/Delete PTransform for simplicity and so the change is more easily visible. In essence, the ramp-up throttler is a generic rate limiter that emits elements only when there is sufficient "budget". This budget starts at 500 entities per second (split across workers) and increases by 50% every 5 minutes, as documented under [Datastore Best Practices](https://cloud.google.com/datastore/docs/best-practices#ramping_up_traffic). Abiding by this rule is not always necessary, the throttling step can be turned off in that case. ### Minor tweaks There have been minor tweaks and adjustments to some of the constants along the way. * Raised target latency for automatic batch sizing from 5 to 6 seconds. * Decreased initial batch size from 200 to 50. * Decresed minimum batch size from 10 to 5. * Added the Beam version to the user agent provided to the Datastore client for easier debugging by the Datastore team. The version of package `google-cloud-datastore` had to be bumped from 1.7.1 to 1.8.0 for that, which is a non-breaking change. R: @chamikaramj ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Warn on BigQuery Job failures
body: Currently if a BigQuery job were to fail because of a data issue, the failures are logged at INFO level. This makes it challenging for users to debug when using streaming `FILE_LOADS` because through the runner (e.g. Dataflow) everything appears fine. Logging at WARN or ERROR will give users more indication that something is wrong with the pipeline.

title: [BEAM-12361] Ensure that Reshuffle.AssignToShard numBuckets is respected
body:
Reshuffle.AssignToShard[1] produces (N*2)-1 buckets, where N is the value of the user-defined numBuckets parameter. This is because the value of the variable having the remainder operator applied, hashOfShard, can be negative and Java's `%` operator has the semantics of `remainder` rather than `modulus`. Is it intentional to produce (N*2)-1 buckets? We should consider the implications of changing this Reshuffle behavior for use cases already employing AssignToShard. Until recently (28 days ago[2]) the class was private, plus Reshuffle is marked as deprecated, so I imagine the impact would be low? title: [BEAM-12273] Support non-multimap materialization in Twister2 runner
body:
Resolving the `beam_fn_api` experiment causes the materialization of side inputs to change. Some are multimap, some are iterable. This PR adjusts the Twister2 runner so that it handles both materializations. I did not try to improve the overall design or execution, but just make both work. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution!
